message.content: This question requires knowledge about the respiratory adaptations of different organisms. Gills are specialized organs found in many aquatic animals, including marlins, that allow them to extract oxygen from water. Option (B) is incorrect because eagles are birds and have lungs for breathing air. Option (C) is incorrect because zebras are land animals and also have lungs for breathing air. Option (D) is incorrect because goats are land animals and do not have gills.

This question requires knowledge about the respiratory systems of different animals. Gills are used by fish, such as marlins, for breathing underwater. Option (B) is incorrect because eagles have lungs and breathe air. Option (C) is incorrect because zebras also have lungs and breathe air. Option (D) is incorrect because goats also have lungs and breathe air.

This question requires knowledge about the respiratory systems of different animals. Gills are used by aquatic animals to extract oxygen from water. Option (A) is the correct answer because marlins, being a type of fish, have gills that allow them to breathe underwater. Options (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because eagles, zebras, and goats are terrestrial animals that do not have gills and do not breathe in water.
